title: @Riot, when will you finally listen to Cassiopeia's playerbase?
body:
I'd like to know why you've abandoned Cassiopeia players and mains alltogether.  [It took us a great deal of effort to finally get Stashu back](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/A9MgbKkB-riot-care-to-explain-why-youve-entirely-abandoned-cassiopeia-in-418) and what does he do? [He simply disappears after dropping off another excuse](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/gFME3v51-on-the-future-of-cassiopeia-also-some-background), just like last time. **The guy literally admitted in his thread that the rework was RUSHED due to time constraints from the Shurima event and now we're stuck with a mutilated snakelady. **He even had the audacity to tell us that there's nothing immediate planned for her. Did it ever occur to you that we want to have a talk with the people responsible for destroying the identity and viability of our favorite champion?

**Now we've arrived at the main issue of this entire rework, this total lack of communication.** I've seen other reworks and they certainly recieved a lot more care than this one. Actual threads created ahead of time (can't say the same about the Cass one on GD) and ongoing dialogue between the project leader(s) and the affected playerbase. None of this took place for Cassiopeia, we didn't even get a single pinned thread. [Speaking of that, how about you finally pin this one?](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/gFME3v51-on-the-future-of-cassiopeia-also-some-background) 

**It's almost as if you're desperately trying to sweep this entire thing under the carpet, but I won't let you.** Not after what you've done to her. If you really want to know why we're so upset with the rework, I strongly advise reading our feedback. Beause so far I've got the impression that you did no such thing. What you need to do is to actually start doing something about this - the longer it takes for you to fix this mess, the longer we suffer. We haven't seen a single trace of PBE changes since several weeks for poor Cass, that needs to change.

**I expect you to start acting like a team that respects its playerbase along with its beloved champions** because this is NOT how you should handle a rework. Bring back Stashu and tell him to take this more seriously. Make him talk **with** us, not **against** us - convince him if you have to. I could have easily posted all of this into his own thread but at this point I doubt that he even pays attention to what we're saying, otherwise this could have been prevented a long time ago. **I'll keep posting about this matter until you've finally taken some action.**
_______________________
**Edit:** If you wish to gain a better insight into our reasoning, [I highly suggest reading this post.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Tf8gcj9v-riot-when-will-you-finally-listen-to-cassiopeias-playerbase?comment=0027)

For those new to the discussion, here's what I gather are many of the reasons why other Cassiopeia players are generally not happy with the rework:

-The new passive combined with low dmg scaling- which makes her very vulnerable early and mid game, and focuses her playstyle on farming minions/stacks and playing passively which is less fun for many who enjoyed her early game harrass and more consistent dmg contribution to games. There are  concerns the passive kicks in too late, she is less versatile with roles (her build path is more linear), and also that her design doesn't really support her carrying well in late game (range, escape options, setup time, dmg scaling, etc..)

-Pretty significant mana issues early on- because of the reliance on spamming a fairly mana intensive ability- twin fang to defend herself (and if twin fang doesn't snag a kill on a minion she doesn't get the refund).  This causes her to have to back early and rush tear. And combined with the passive means she can't wander out of lane much until later.

-Her DOT/Poison identity has been drastically reduced, which is what some felt was core to a snake themed champion like Cassiopeia- Her Q and W both have pretty mild dmg outputs now, and she has lost her ability to harrass and aoe in favor of Twin Fang dives (which may be riskier for a character who is squishy and lacking escapes). This also means that point investments in these two abilities after the initial point don't really mean as much. To add to that part of the reason it was reduced is bc Riot felt her DOT theme clashed with other champions like "Brand, Rumble, Swain, Zyra, Malzahar, and even Mordekaiser" which doesn't make sense.

-Her win rates.  While these are a bit better than what they were at first on release (<40% until E was fixed) they are still hovering around ~46%. This is still not really a viable position, and maybe its partially due to more dedicated mains trying her than new players which help inflate it, but that's probably stretching it some tbh.  Its not where it should be in any case.

-Skin changes/Visual Update- Some examples: The new model doesn't match up with her new splash (tail color, scale width, etc..). The Desperada skin lost the cooler tail design from before for a pretty plain brown one, and some preferred the old Desperada splash as well. She is less pretty- and it doesnt' fit the seductress theme as well. Her new icon reminds people of Wukong's icon...

-Lore concerns- Her new lore is very short (a longer version may be hinted for release). She never seems to show her charisma/seducing qualities in the event (she just stabs Sivir). Why the snake trap? How does it protect what's inside? Isn't the curse (animal hybrid) something Shurima considered an ascedant quality? 

-And finally, Lack of Communication by Riot.   The changes were rushed through testing (like 2 days?) there was plenty of feedback which was never considered- including a bug on E which damaged her early release. Some feel there is a confirmation bias towards which replies were looked at (generally ones that liked the new direction). Wildly popular threads (nearly 300 on the old board) on her only get an early red response but then followed by silence, and are not pinned- leading to the feeling of being ignored. There has been little to nothing for her hitting public test (the only changes to date have been pretty minor- even though more had been promised to be in the works- its felt excruciatingly long for people waiting for these seeing new patches come and go with nothing)

I'm sorry, but the Cass rework and the Karma rework are not at all the same.  Karma was a real rework, with time and effort put in.  New Karma was even more viable than the old Karma had been.  A handful of people who liked her niche playstyle didn't like it, but a whole slew of new people liked new Karma, as shown by the fact she has seen more play since then.  Nobody who plays the new Cass likes it; a handful say the IDEA of her passive is interesting, but once you actually try her out, you realize the passive doesn't make her more powerful even maxed out.  The Karma example is one of how sometimes the overly vocal forum community can be wrong, because they don't represent the sentiment of the larger community.  The Cass example is one of Riot ignoring everyone, even non-forum goers, who've made their feelings known by the plummeting rates of Cass in games.

Thank you for proving the point I made with the Karma rework example!  You immediately dismiss the fall out from the karma rework (when we had Scarizard actually discussing things with us only for most of it to be ultimately ignored) and somehow feel that the way Stashu has handled this is completely different! 

You have also dismissed the very same "Overly vocal forum community" that you are trying to back up here. You can't say that it should work here but not for Karma because you like Cass more.

I don't like Cass.  I don't play her, and she wasn't my main before.  I tried her out and theorycrafted her post-rework, and she is in an abysmal state.  So that is not why I'm saying the two situations are different.

They are different because the circumstances are entirely different.  Yes, there is a small similarity in the way in which a Riot employee interacted with the forum community, being dismissive and uncaring of the community's opinion.  I'm saying that in Karma's case, there was a good reason for that dismissiveness.  While you and other old Karma fans complained on the forums, Karma saw her pick rates rise, indicating that the larger playerbase was perfectly happy with Karma's rework.  It sucks that you liked old Karma more, but Riot wasn't wrong to change her, as evidenced by the greater playtime she has seen since.  Cass is different; the rework was rushed to match the Shurima events and it made her weaker overall when the stated goal was to make her weaker early and stronger late.  Her pick rates weren't great before the rework, but now her pick rates and win rates are falling to horrific lows.  The general playerbase agrees with what those on the forums are saying; nobody wants to play her in the state in which she exists now.

Sigh, sadly, the major thing to take away from all of this is just one thing. Back in the original cass thread on GD I asked stashu if he thought he made a mistake with this whole rework, his response? "No."

Stashu fimrly believes he was not and is not wrong with the direction he has taken cass, and that is the major problem here. Cass isn't as popular as lee sin, she is not a pivotal professional pick, so it does not matter how much we cry about it, we won't get the changes reverted due to the sheer fact that riot believes they were not mistaken with this rework.

I pity cass, I really do. I was never a cass main, but I did enjoy playing her from time to time. I even almost got a penta with her once (it was an unofficial one because the blasted sona took too long to chase down and kill) but I will refuse to play cass as long as she is in her current condition.

They must finally fix this unplayable mess, she's literally worse than Poppy at this point. All it takes is giving first blood with her and you're instantly useless for the rest of the game - and pray to god their jungler isn't camping you. Her laning phase is downright horrendous and an insult to anyone who used to play Cass before the rework. She has become THE Urgot of midlane.

She literally has no comeback potential anymore since her damage is entirely limited to her Twin Fangs now, a short range ability which already puts you in great danger. Her poke and aoe-damage are nonexistent, it's impossible to play her safely. Against popular midlaners like Zed she's as good as dead the second she enters lane. Combined with her awful waveclear and unreasonable manacosts she fails to clear waves fast enough to even keep up with the constant pressure.

This Cassiopeia will never make it into lategame, all thanks to that godawful passive which somehow justifies gutting her ratios entirely. I used to humilate assassins back then with my insane lane dominance and strong early game which enabled me to shut them down before they could even snowball, now I'm just the prey waiting to be slaughtered. There's absolutely no place on mid for her anymore.

**tl;dr: Cassiopeia is unviable due to being immobile, short ranged and inherently squishy. Combined with her terribly delayed powerspike and awful laning phase, she's nothing more but a liability to her team. There is absolutely no joy left in playing her.**

I completely understand why people are upset over this. Cass is a cool champion, she has fun abilities, neat theme, really cool skins, everything: she's awesome, and she deserves to be played. There are obviously problems with her weak early game and not having the tools to make it to the late game. Stashu himself admitted as much. But acting all self-entitled isn't going to get us anywhere. Demanding answers isn't going to find a good fix for Cass any sooner; I'd much rather they spend their time actually working out those changes rather than vaguely talking about them. 

The thread you reference [(the Stashu thread here)](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/gFME3v51-on-the-future-of-cassiopeia-also-some-background) explains everything we need to know right now. In it, Stashu says:

> the primary reason why we had no changes for 4.18 is that we still haven't fully determined which tools to add to/bolster on Cassiopeia's kit.
